data.title: Fix crash related to TileMap2D when no scene is set
data.body:
Hello, here is a fix for the following case :

 * Create a node without a scene
 * Add TileMap2D component
 * call SetTmxFile(...)

This was crashing because 'renderer_' was null in StaticSprite2D.

Now it won't crash and StaticSprite2D will update its material when added to a scene.

data.title: CollisionShape::SetTriangleMesh does not work
data.body:
It seems **SetTriangleMesh** cannot work properly.
for a quick test: 

1. add **mass = 1** to the mushrooms, and they will just fall down off the terrain.
2. change **SetTriangleMesh** to **SetConvexHull**, they sit still on the terrain.

so in this test, **SetConvexHull works but SetTriangleMesh fails**.

data.title: possible GeometryType geometry enum bug
data.body:
When I serfed in Urho code, I found that GeometryType enum declared on Graphics/GraphicsDefs.h:51 seems broken.

/// %Geometry type.
enum GeometryType
{
    GEOM_STATIC = 0,
    GEOM_SKINNED = 1,
    GEOM_INSTANCED = 2,
    GEOM_BILLBOARD = 3,
    GEOM_DIRBILLBOARD = 4,
    GEOM_TRAIL_FACE_CAMERA = 5,
    GEOM_TRAIL_BONE = 6,
    GEOM_STATIC_NOINSTANCING = 7,
    MAX_GEOMETRYTYPES = 7,
};

MAX_GEOMETRYTYPES value is equal to the prev value, but it is obviously wrong. MAX_GEOMETRYTYPES must be 8 or must be left unassigned. I searched for another enum bugs like this, but fortunately in other enums last "MAX_*" is value left unassigned.

data.title: Update FreeType to 2.7.1.
data.body: Seems to compile cleanly on the CI without the code customizations we had in the past (like changing platform checks / disabling assembler code), and at least the editor fonts seem to render OK. Opened for review / testing. Closes issue #1775.

data.title: Texture appears as black on Web
data.body:
Hi, I attempted to add the following texture on a diffuse material. I always get a dark model when applying for it.

DiffuseMaterial.xml
```xml
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<material>
	<technique name="Techniques/Diff.xml" />
	<texture unit="diffuse" name="Textures/BARK5.jpg" />
	<parameter name="MatSpecColor" value="0 0 0 1" />
</material>
```

![bark5](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11297739/22171622/72090504-df9a-11e6-9088-574cc2212b35.jpg)

data.title: (Feature request) Update FreeType
data.body:
In my font generator I am using FreeType library directly and I had a problem - I could not debug the project from Visual Studio (when I press F5 I recieve access error some within FreeType lib), but compiled and runned *.exe worked perfect. So I just ignored the problem.

Today I replaced FT_Set_Char_Size (set font size in points) to FT_Set_Pixel_Sizes (set font size in pixels) and FT_Glyph_Stroke stopped working correctly.

I updated FreeType lib to 2.7.1 version (just replace files and recompile engine) and it solved both problems

data.title: Remake 'Anonymous Pro.sdf' font
data.body:
Old version https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/pull/1770 had problems with some glyphs.

![3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13021826/22116570/f21be578-de81-11e6-8df6-59d036c1809e.png)

This is caused by too small image size

![test1_0](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13021826/22116618/1a558bac-de82-11e6-926d-b9e7dd3bca35.png)

So I recreate it with another font size (anyway user can scale SDF font to any size). It also solved problem with elevated glyphs.

But now Anonimous Pro used 2 pages instead 1.

data.title: Update AngelScript
data.body: Updates AngelScript to version 2.31.2. Customizations regarding platform support (e.g. Emscripten generic call convention) should be preserved. Whoever has time, please review. Addons (array & dictionary) were only fixed where necessary without taking completely new code from the SDK, for easier work of preserving customizations. Closes issue #1728

data.title: Cardboard Support
data.body:
I haven't tried to implement Urh03D yet, but i'm looking for a Android compatible library that is similar to Apple SceneKit so I can re-implement my popular native(Obj-C, SceneKit, OpenGl 2.0) iOS Google Cardboard app for Android.  I know I could use Unity, but Unity is overkill for a vr video player app.  Would Urh03D suffice to display unlit 3d geometry with images/videos textures, multiple cameras (with geometry just for one camera), and perform hit testing?

In the past I successfully use SceneKit + OpenGl 2.0 to create a Google Cardboard app on iOS without Unity or Google Cardboard, everything is native.  So I think Urh03D would also work, but I would need to do a similar thing, which is render the left eye to a target texture and then restart and render the right eye and hit test to detect looking at 3d icons.

data.title: Serializable attributes meta information.
data.body:
Inspired by Unity and #1741
I plan to implement a kind of attribute meta information.

Introduce new (probably virtual) class (e.g. `AttributeMetaInfo`).
Add optional pointer to `AttributeInfo` that specifies attribute meta information.
By design, meta information mustn't be used in Urho core and affect important processes like serialization.
However, it can (and will) be freely used by customers who need some facultative information about attributes.

Examples of meta info:
- Vector information from #1742
- Bitmask view flag
- Realtime apply control (now relatime apply is disabled for some hard-coded attributes)
- (New) Value ranges for numeric attributes and many other things.

I am going to work on it when I publish usable version of my Editor because I am going to use this feature for it. I am __not__ going to add any features to current script Editor.

Opened issue for discussion and as reminder.

data.title: AngelScript ScriptFile Class Crashes in Mingw (Mingw-w64) Release build
data.body:
I noticed this a while back but couldn't investigate at that moment. 
Traced it down later to discover that the issue is somewhat related to ScriptFile class as is evident in Urho3DPlayer application. This mainly occurs when a subsystem is accessed through script hence the reason why there is no crash in 21_AngelScriptIntegration since the scriptfile does not access any subsystem.

The biggest puzzle is that this crash does not surface in debug build.

I tried using the barest minimally configured build setting with the default provided mingw build batch file 
`cmake_mingw.bat <my_build_directory> -DURHO3D_PACKAGING=1  -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=<my_installation_directory>`
and still the crash was there.

My system is 64bit Windows10 OS with 8gb of ram, the MinGW setup is i686-5.1.0-posix-dwarf-rt_v4-rev0 .

data.title: Fix copy-paste error in comment to URHO3D_ACCESSOR_VARIANT_VECTOR_STRUCTURE_ATTRIBUTE.
Reduce number of change objects in each web samples upload commit
data.body: We have just changed the web sample upload task to be executed on each CI build. In the past this was only executed on packaging build. This is all good, except that the commit size is bigger than absolutely necessary, i.e. the object could just differ simply due to UUID of the asset package which is almost guaranteed to be different for each CI build. When nothing is done, this will certainly bloat the commit history size on the urho3d/urho3d.github.io repository.

data.title: CommandLine.txt ignored when packed
data.body:
As stated in the title, game not loading anything when I pack all resources to Data.pak and CoreData.pak. But if I create empty folder Data, and copy CommandLine.txt there, all works just as needed. I used precompiled Urho3D-1.6-Windows-64bit-SHARED and Lua as scripting language.

Is this a bug or expected behavior?

data.title: SDF supersampling
data.body:
Only GL version currently. Supersampling can be disabled by comment define.
SDF rendering improved even without using supersampling (dynamic calculation of border width + smoothstep for outline). But outlines and shadows still dirty for far distance. Any notes?
